Dude, its Half-Life. It reinvented the first-person shooter and showed that the genre could be more than just a mindless kill-fest. Don the orange hazard suit of Gordon Freeman, theoretical physicist at the Black Mesa Research Facility. Battle the hordes of Xin as well as black ops Marines looking to silence you for all time. You pushed that crystal into the beam, now it is time to save the world...or at least yourself.
what a ride this game was, thx valve

Half-life (symbol t1⁄2) is the time required for a quantity to reduce to half its initial value. The term is commonly used in nuclear physics to describe how quickly unstable atoms undergo, or how long stable atoms survive, radioactive decay. The term is also used more generally to characterize any type of exponential or non-exponential decay. For example, the medical sciences refer to the biological half-life of drugs and other chemicals in the human body. The converse of half-life is doubling time.

The original term, half-life period, dating to Ernest Rutherford's discovery of the principle in 1907, was shortened to half-life in the early 1950s. Rutherford applied the principle of a radioactive element's half-life to studies of age determination of rocks by measuring the decay period of radium to lead-206.

Half-life is constant over the lifetime of an exponentially decaying quantity, and it is a characteristic unit for the exponential decay equation.

Если заглянули на страничку этой игры, знайте - это не просто классика, это величайшая игра.
Пройдено ни один раз, а если точнее - 317 раз разными способами, на пиратке и на лицухе. 
Знайте! баги эту игру красят нежели портят.
Только тут солдат может вам подкинуть сюрприз в виде подствольной гранаты, аккурат подкинутой в дверной проход.
Только тут можно вспомнить как выглядит шедевр что непоколебимо стоял на высоте 98-го года.
Респект вентилю за данный проект и его продолжения!

Half-Life is a game that holds up surprisingly well in 2019. The game has a thrilling story, fast-action gameplay, and standards that really set the foundations for modern FPS. This game could not be recommended enough, as it is truly an amazing relic, and a masterpiece.

Jugar a Half Life por primera vez en 2019 es una experiencia muy dura. Lo compre junto a Half Life 2 porque me interesaba el universo que habia creado ValvE despues de haber jugado a los dos Portals y siendo un clasico de PC tenia curiosidad. 

Lo he jugado sabiendo que es un juego antiguo, pero los controles tan torpes y incomodos que tiene lastran demasiado la experiencia hasta el punto que el juego deja de ser divertido, los bugs de vez en cuando tambien impedian seguir el nivel. 

Ojo, no dudo que en su tiempo fuera una revolucion y que fuera bueno por entonces, y entiendo que la mayoria tengais nostalgia hacia el juego pero esta es la review de alguien que lo completa en 2019. Es por eso que no puedo recomendar el juego en si para nuevos jugadores a no ser que te interese mucho la historia del mundo del videojuego, entonces adelante.

Hands down the best game I've ever played. Join Dr. Gordon Freeman on his adventures through the Black Mesa Research Facility (BMRF). Fight unique monsters, entities, and even the U.S Military as you struggle to escape the facility. This game is one of the first FPS games to feature a story (which is pretty neat, too!) Also, this game is basically the reason that Steam exists, so yeah.

Still a fantastic experience!

Half-Life is a creative and unique game even 20 years after its original release. The graphics, while they may look outdated, perfectly fit the aesthetic of the game, along with its locations. The game-play is fresh and interesting, with unique puzzles and enemies along your path through Black Mesa. The music is also pretty good. My biggest issue with the game is Xen, because the game then devolves to long jumping across platforms. While the game still has its flaws, it is a must play for anyone. I would absolutely recommend.

Graphics: 8/10
Gameplay: 9/10
Sound: 9/10

Overall: 8/10

Игра выпуска 1998 года была лучшей в конце 90ых-начале 2000ых, сейчас это просто старая хорошая игрушка с хорошими воспоминаниями. Нестареющая классика. Если ты раньше не пробовал её пройти и решишь сыграть сейчас, ты, возможно, спросишь себя «почему ее полюбили?» и «стоит ли вообще за это дело браться»?
Вот несколько плюсов, которые помогут определится:
•	Отличный гейм-дизайн
•	Разнообразие оружия
•	Куча противников
•	На удивление умный ИИ
•	Брутальный протагонист
•	Бесшовная подача сюжета
•	Отличнейший сеттинг
В общем, ничего лишнего: пришёл, увидел, победил! Динамично, лаконично, зрелищно и интересно.

Итого 8.5 из 10

Unbelievably atmospheric. It's easy to see it's influence and it's innovations. Still better than probably everything coming out today. Everyone needs to play this game at least once. If you want perfect buildup and suspense, this is it chief. This game is fucking incredible. The only things that annoy me are some dated platforming sections which hamper gameplay at times. Outside of that, i think it's pretty much golden. Obviously it looks old, sounds old, IS old. But if you aren't mentally deficient, you can see why this game is incredible. Sometimes it's not about crazy ass action and explosions and badass cutscenes. Sometimes all you need is to play a game about a dude trying to escape hell with a crowbar and a pistol. Also, play this in the dark. It's not 100% horror, but my god. Playing alone in the dark at night just makes the game more whole. You'll see what i mean.

Rientro fra le pochissime persone che sconsigliano questo gioco, o meglio dire capolavoro.
Se è un capolavoro perchè mai dovrei sconsigliarlo? Vi starete chiedendo.
Partiamo dal fatto che Half Life è un gioco fantastico e una volta finito ti viene voglia di rigiocarlo.. Bhe, a me viene voglia di farlo, ma penso che non lo farò, o non ora.
Il gioco è molto difficile, ma bello, il problema è quando ci sono dei bug completamente casuali che ti rovinano l'esperienza di gioco e ogni volta che stai giocando passi da un momento all'altro ad ammettere quanto sia bello Half Life ad ammettere quanto sia buggato e ingiocabile per colpa dei Bug.
1)Molto spesso non so perchè morivo senza un motivo valido, toccavo qualcosa che in teoria non doveva farmi danno e morivo
2)Il gioco crashava e ogni volta dovevo ripartire da un punto difficile che avevo già superato
3)Una volta ho avviato il gioco e invece di farmelo partire in 1920 x 1080 me lo ha messo in una risoluzione che a malapena potevo leggere qualcosa del menù principale, (come se non bastasse la schermata iniziale del gioco era pure capovolta)
4)Molte volte gli scienziati che dovevano aprirmi le porte o darmi accesso a qualsiasi cosa si buggavano inspiegabilmente e rimanevano fermi immobili e dovevo ricominciare dall'ultimo punto
5) Verso gli ultimi 20 minuti prima di finire il gioco (in cui si va verso Xen e bisogna sconfiggere quella specie di aracnide gigante con una specie di massa tumorale sotto la pancia) il gioco ha deciso di sua volontà di resettarmi i comandi, non potevo nemmeno ripristinarli automaticamente perchè il gioco non me lo faceva fare, cosi ho speso un tempo abbastanza considerevole per reimpostare manualmente tutto 
6) Questa forse è stata una delle cose che mi ha fatto più incazzare, verso la fine del gioco (ancora prima di affrontare il boss che sembra un bambino con la progeria) mi è scomparso il mirino, esatto, il mirino che ho tenuto attivato per tutto il gioco mi è scomparso a caso. Ho fatto di tutto ma nelle opzioni non c'era nulla che potessi fare per riattivare e far rendere visibile il puntatore sullo schermo. Ho dovuto risolvere accontentandomi della mira automatica.
Per tutto il gioco ho dovuto affrontare questi problemi ripetutamente evitando di usare cheats o mod, ma verso alla fine ho dovuto attivare il trucco Noclip e God (per sconfiggere il boss) perchè senza mirino e con una esperienza di gioco ORRIBILE attivare 2 trucchi proprio alla fine senza mai averli usati prima d'ora mi sembrava il minimo dopo tutto.
Con questo non sto dicendo che Half Life sia un pessimo gioco, perchè lo conosco e so bene che non è così. Dico solo che da come l'ho dovuto giocare io è stata davvero una pessima esperienza, spero solo che la prossima volta in cui deciderò di rimetterci mano sopra non dovrò imbattermi di nuovo nelle stesse problematiche

A classic first person shooter that you should definitely consider playing. The action is solid, the atmosphere is amazing, and enemy variety is surprisingly varied for a game that was released in 1998. It should be noted that sometimes the game loses direction and becomes a bit tedious. This is especially true for the last chapter which taints the entire experience that came before it with an abundance of tedium and no direction whatsoever.

You should consider getting this game if you are a fan of other first person shooters or other valve titles.
YARIM-HAYAT
2 worze

Gordon Freeman, in the flesh, or rather, in the hazard suit.

PROS: The gameplay is some of the best crafted FPS shooting of it's day.  The controls are tight and responsive, and the weapons have a proper amount of kick to them (at least the human weapons).  The alien weapons all feel wonderfully bizarre.  The soundtrack is a mix of haunting and powerful, chosen to certain scenes to showcase the feel behind an otherwise silent protagonist.  The action can feel a tad schizophrenic from time to time, depending on the enemies, though it mostly feels satisfying.  The real shine goes to the story, however.  The game tells an interwoven tale with no cutscenes or dialogue from Dr. Freeman, putting the player through their paces to reach the conclusion.

CONS: The action suddenly jumps from one moment to another, sometime with little indication that things are about to change.  The real problem is first person platforming.  It feels very awkward, and makes the game difficult for poor reasons.  And surprisingly, there is a fair amount of it.

FINAL: Half-Life is still a pinnacle of gaming, not just for it's time.  It still holds up the ideals of classic FPS action mingled with a cryptic story that not only allows the player to give Gordon Freeman some characterization through their own interpretation, but also leave small hints of a bigger plot beyond what you're seeing through the Physicist's eyes.  Though I would recommend the Source version more, either is a wonderful experience.

Half-Life is one of those classic games that have stood the test of time. The story is pretty straight forward. You play the average scientist man Gordon Freeman in his escape from a science facility where everything's gone to Hell. It's kind of an afterthought and serves to lay out the action. It's basically an action movie plot, and it works pretty well. The characters are memorable enough and the overall plot is good enough to keep you focused on the end goal. There's also lots of little touches I love that add to the experience, such as the slow beginning that gets you acquainted with the world you're in, and level details that give a little character to everything. The combat feels nice and gives a decent variety of approaches to various combat situations. There's plenty of weapon variety, with every weapon feeling fun to use. Gunfights are tense and ammo is just scarce enough to make you strategize when and where you use it, but plentiful enough to where you get to use all of the different weapons regularly. Most of the levels are great and provide a decent mix of experiences with their own unique difficulties to overcome. None of the levels are particularly bad, but some of them have gameplay ideas that fall flat and are more annoying than fun. The graphics are obviously very outdated by today's standards, but the style and design still hold up. The character and enemy designs are fantastic and the alien designs in particular are very memorable are some of my favourite aliens in any media. The limitations on the graphics and sound design create an atmosphere that makes the game eerie. Overall I'd say it's aged much better than other games released around the same time frame. The AI, however, has aged pretty poorly from my experience. Enemies are ripe for cheap exploits, and allies are excruciatingly stupid at times. The AI is definitely the weakest part of the game for me, but I'm not too upset by it considering the age of the game. The gameplay still feels tight enough to overcome the AI's shortcomings.

Here's an overall breakdown of the game for me.

Pros:
-Fun gun play open to different approaches
-Weapon variety
-Memorable story
-Great level structure with different ideas that spice up gameplay
-Top notch alien designs
-Eerie atmosphere

Cons:
-AI can be frustrating to deal with at times
-Some levels feel weak

What more can I say, it's Half-Life. It's the classic game it is for a reason. A revolutionary game in the world of first person shooters that helped make Valve what they are today. It still holds up to this day with ideas that still feel modern mixed with a retro style that comes out very nice. If you haven't played it yet, and you like first person shooters, go ahead and get it. Wait for a sale if you want to, but it's definitely worth a play.
